intro: Hordeum vulgare var. glabrierectum, commonly known as the smooth upright barley, is a variety of barley characterized by its glabrous (smooth) surface and upright growth habit. It is a member of the grass family (Poaceae) and is native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. This variety is typically shorter and more compact compared to other barley types, which makes it suitable for specific agricultural and horticultural applications. Its grains are generally smaller and have a distinct, pale coloration. The plant is often cultivated for forage or as a specialty grain due to its unique morphology and adaptability to various climates.
